appearances.title: Way Too Early With Ali Vitali : MSNOW : January 15, 2026 2:00am-3:00am PST
appearances.snippet: want to bring in democratic congressman of virginia, suhas subramanyam?rst of all, can you just take us behind the scenes on the contempt piece of this in regards to the clintons? because i've spoken to robert garcia. of course, the top democrat on the committee, your colleague. and he has made clear that he wants to pursue this issue without party fear or favor. and so he has supported the idea of bringing the clintons before them, specifically bill clinton. i still question where hillary clinton comes into this, but bill clinton has been seen in many of the photos released by the epstein estate. so where does this stand, and do you support holding them in contempt for defying a congressional subpoena? >> yeah, well, let's be clear. we have to be consistent about the way we're treating people. or subpoenaing the doj, for instance, has not given us millions of documents. they're breaking the law right now. we're not we're not talking about contempt with them. right. so, you know, from the very beginning, i supported subpoenaing anyone who has information.

appearances.title: BBC News America : KQED : January 16, 2026 5:30pm-6:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: suhas subramanyam he serves on the house oversight committee.sman, it's great to see you again. i want to ask you about what we have heard from the department of justice here, saying it's made significant progress and that it's actually working with victims counsel and victims themselves to ensure that redactions are done properly. what do you think of that? well, part of the law that we passed and that the president signed into law states that they need to explain the redactions to us and they have not done that. they missed that deadline as well. so they haven't been doing that. they told us last march that they had all the files ready to release that they were on pam bondi's desk, the attorney general, and they told us many times after that that they had the files that they're ready to go. and now all of a sudden they're finding new files. they have too much. they don't have enough capacity to release files. it seems like their story has been changing many times over the past year and a half. have they given you any indication of when we migh
